thread.title: Mulberry's finance director sells shares

title: Mulberry's finance director sells shares
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 9, 2015, 19:08 BST - UK Markets closed Mulberry's finance director sells shares By Jessica Fino | Sharecast – 1 hour 38 minutes ago 0.19 +0.015 
LONDON (ShareCast) - The finance director of Mulberry sold a big part of his stake in the luxury brand one day after its new creative director Johnny Coca joined the company. Roger Mather, who has been at the British fashion house since 2007, sold 70,000 shares at 450p each, bringing home a total of £315,000. 
Following the sale, Mather's beneficial interest in the company stood at 113,687 ordinary shares. 
Two years after the departure of its former creative director Emma Hill, Mulberry on Wednesday welcomed Johnny Coca on board. 
He will be responsible for all the company's sections. 
Coca previously worked for Céline, where he was head design director for leather, goods, shoes, hard accessories, jewellery and sunglasses.
